text:
Leaving from the hospital after a high-risk event can be daunting for #OlderAdults. That’s why JASA developed its home-based care transition program, providing non-clinical health and social services to those with complex care needs. Learn more about their successful initiative in this webinar on April 22. https://bit.ly/3tA3Z8E

AGINGANDDISABILITYBUSINESSINSTITUTE.ORG
JASA’s Care Transitions Intervention for Older Adults: Integrating Health Care and Social Services - Aging and Disability Business Institute

text:
"Chronic staffing shortages in nursing homes stretch existing staff to breaking points. These jobs of frontline workers, like certified nursing assistants (CNAs), are often as difficult as retail and fast food and usually pay less (the average annual income for a CNA in a nursing home is $28,450). The result? Employees don't stick around."

NEXTAVENUE.ORG
The Nursing Home Vulnerabilities That Led to Disaster

The result? Employees don't stick around."

text:
Justine Bateman has done a lot. The "Family Ties" star enrolled in college in her 40s, and is now a screenwriter and director. One thing Justine, 55, hasn't done — and never will do? Get plastic surgery. In her new book, she delves into why.

AARP.ORG
Justine Bateman Wants Women to Love Their Aging Faces

Did you know that by 2020, nearly one million will be living with Parkinson's disease (PD) in the U.S.?

This year on #WorldParkinsonsDay, we're rallying behind Parkinson's Foundation to help spread awareness about PD with their #KnowMorePD quiz.

Test your knowledge of PD and spread the word.
https://bit.ly/3rGPa2F

text:
Special Supplemental Benefits for the Chronically Ill (SSBCI) offer non-medical health related services to #Medicare recipients with complex care needs. Services range from groceries to quality indoor ventilation to pest control. In this Better Care Playbook blog, authors from Long-Term Quality Alliance and ATI Advisory examine how these benefits can improve living conditions for #OlderAdults. https://bit.ly/3sLDBZH

BETTERCAREPLAYBOOK.ORG
Special Supplemental Benefits for the Chronically Ill: An Opportunity to Provide Comprehensive Supports for Medicare Beneficiaries with Complex Needs | Playbook
